intro: Aulomyrcia dealbata var. pallida, commonly known as the white-flowered myrtle, is a shrub native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and showy white flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils and prefers partial to full shade. Its foliage is often covered in a fine, whitish bloom, giving it a distinctive appearance. This variety is closely related to other members of the Myrtaceae family, sharing similar botanical features.
